prompt: Photorealistic macro shot focusing on the cast iron nameplate of an antique wood stove, possibly reading 'Glenwood' or 'Round Oak'. The lettering is raised and slightly worn, capturing intricate details of the metal texture and subtle patina. Lighting is dramatic, low-key side lighting casting deep shadows, highlighting the embossed text. Shallow depth of field blurs the surrounding stove body, drawing the eye directly to the identification mark. Composition uses the rule of thirds, placing the nameplate off-center within the 16:9 frame, emphasizing the aged material. --ar 16:9 --style raw --v 6.0
name: antique-wood-stove-identification-image-1.png

prompt: Expansive wide-angle view of a restorer's workshop or barn interior, filled with various antique wood stoves in different stages of identification and repair. Natural light streams through a large dusty window, illuminating several distinct stove types (parlor, potbelly, cookstove). Tools, reference manuals, and spare cast iron parts are scattered on workbenches and the floor. The composition uses leading lines formed by rows of stoves to create depth within the 16:9 landscape format. Atmosphere is slightly nostalgic, photorealistic, capturing the essence of antique stove collection and preservation. --ar 16:9 --style raw --v 6.0
name: antique-wood-stove-identification-image-2.png

prompt: Medium shot capturing an ornate, nickel-plated antique parlor stove with intricate cast iron scrollwork and mica windows, situated elegantly in the corner of a dimly lit Victorian room. Soft, warm light emanates from an unseen source (perhaps a nearby lamp or faint simulated fire glow from within the stove), reflecting off the polished nickel and highlighting the room's period details like dark wood flooring and patterned wallpaper visible in the wide 16:9 frame. Composition places the stove slightly off-center, emphasizing its grandeur and historical context. Photorealistic style with rich textures and moody ambiance. --ar 16:9 --style raw --v 6.0
name: antique-wood-stove-identification-image-3.png

prompt: Eye-level shot of a large, functional antique cast iron kitchen cookstove (e.g., a 'Home Comfort' or 'Majestic' model) set within a rustic, sunlit farmhouse kitchen. The stove features multiple burner lids, warming ovens, and perhaps a water reservoir. Simple period cookware like a cast iron skillet and a copper kettle sit on top. The 16:9 landscape composition showcases the full width of the stove and its integration into the kitchen environment, including wooden countertops or shelves nearby. Lighting is bright, natural daylight. Photorealistic, detailed style emphasizing sturdy construction and utility. --ar 16:9 --style raw --v 6.0
name: antique-wood-stove-identification-image-4.png

prompt: Split-image composition or side-by-side detailed close-ups within a single 16:9 frame, contrasting an antique wood stove component before and after restoration. Left side: A close-up of a heavily rusted cast iron door hinge or air damper, obscuring manufacturer markings. Right side: The identical component meticulously restored, clean, with polished metal and clearly visible embossed patent dates or logos. Neutral, even studio lighting across both halves ensures accurate comparison. Ultra-photorealistic detail, focusing sharply on texture differences (rust vs. smooth iron) and the revealed identifying marks. --ar 16:9 --style raw --v 6.0
name: antique-wood-stove-identification-image-5.png
